templates.name: Contributing Guide
templates.description: Guidelines for how others can contribute to your project.

content.en:
# ü§ù Contributing to [PROJECT_NAME]

Thank you for considering contributing to this project! This guide will help you understand how to contribute effectively and make the most impact.

## üéØ How to Contribute

### üêõ Reporting Bugs

If you found a bug in [PROJECT_NAME]:

1. **Check if an issue already exists** about the problem
2. **Create a new issue** with:
   - Clear description of the bug
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Expected vs actual behavior
   - Screenshots (if applicable)

### ‚ú® Suggesting Improvements

To suggest new features or improvements:

1. **Clearly describe** the desired functionality
2. **Explain the problem** it solves
3. **Provide examples** of how it should work
4. **Consider implementing** it yourself if possible

### üìù Improving Documentation

Documentation is always welcome! You can help with:

- Fixing typos and grammar errors
- Improving explanations and clarity
- Adding examples and use cases
- Translating to other languages

## üõ†Ô∏è Contribution Process

### 1. Fork the Repository

```bash
# Clone your fork
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/[REPO_NAME].git
cd [REPO_NAME]

# Add the original repository as upstream
git remote add upstream https://github.com/[USERNAME]/[REPO_NAME].git
```

### 2. Create a Branch

```bash
# Create a branch for your contribution
git checkout -b feature/your-contribution-name
```

### 3. Make Your Changes

- **Keep consistency** with existing style
- **Test your changes** before submitting
- **Document** new features
- **Update CHANGELOG.md** if necessary

### 4. Commit and Push

```bash
# Add your changes
git add .

# Commit with descriptive message
git commit -m "feat: add new feature for [PROJECT_NAME]"

# Push to your branch
git push origin feature/your-contribution-name
```

### 5. Open Pull Request

1. **Go to your fork** on GitHub
2. **Click "New Pull Request"**
3. **Fill out the template** provided
4. **Wait for review**

## üìã Code Standards

### [PROJECT_TYPE] Standards

- **Follow [CODING_STYLE]** guidelines
- **Write clear comments** for complex code
- **Use meaningful variable names**
- **Keep functions small and focused**

### Commit Messages

Use the [Conventional Commits](https://conventionalcommits.org/) standard:

```
feat: add new [FEATURE_TYPE] functionality
fix: resolve [ISSUE_TYPE] in [COMPONENT]
docs: update [DOCUMENTATION_SECTION]
style: improve [STYLING_ELEMENT] formatting
```

### Naming Conventions

- **Files**: Use descriptive names (e.g., `user-authentication.js`)
- **Branches**: `feature/description`, `fix/description`, `docs/description`
- **Variables**: Use camelCase or snake_case consistently

## üß™ Testing Your Changes

Before submitting, test your changes:

1. **Run existing tests**: `[TEST_COMMAND]`
2. **Test your new features** thoroughly
3. **Check for regressions** in existing functionality
4. **Verify documentation** is accurate
5. **Test on different [PLATFORMS/ENVIRONMENTS]**

## üìù Types of Contributions

### üÜï New Features

- [FEATURE_CATEGORY_1] improvements
- [FEATURE_CATEGORY_2] additions
- [FEATURE_CATEGORY_3] enhancements
- Performance optimizations

### üîß Bug Fixes

- Fix [BUG_TYPE_1] issues
- Resolve [BUG_TYPE_2] problems
- Address [BUG_TYPE_3] concerns
- Security improvements

### üìö Documentation

- Usage guides
- API documentation
- Code comments
- Translation improvements

### üé® Design

- UI/UX improvements
- Accessibility enhancements
- Visual consistency
- Responsive design

## üéØ Roadmap

### Upcoming Features

- [ ] [UPCOMING_FEATURE_1]
- [ ] [UPCOMING_FEATURE_2]
- [ ] [UPCOMING_FEATURE_3]
- [ ] [UPCOMING_FEATURE_4]

### Priority Contributions

1. **[PRIORITY_1]**
2. **[PRIORITY_2]**
3. **[PRIORITY_3]**
4. **[PRIORITY_4]**

## ‚ùì Questions?

If you have questions about contributing:

1. **Open an issue** with the `question` tag
2. **Check existing issues** for similar questions
3. **Contact maintainers** via [CONTACT_METHOD]

## üèÜ Recognition

Contributors will be recognized:

- In the contributors section of README
- In the CHANGELOG.md file
- In project releases
- On the project website (if applicable)

## üìÑ License

By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the [LICENSE_TYPE] License.

---

**Thank you for contributing to [PROJECT_NAME]! üéâ**

Every contribution, no matter how small, makes a difference for the community.

## üí° Pro Tips for Contributors

### üé® Development Tips

1. **Read the codebase** - Understand the project structure first
2. **Start small** - Begin with documentation or small bug fixes
3. **Ask questions** - Don't hesitate to ask for clarification
4. **Test thoroughly** - Make sure your changes work as expected
5. **Follow conventions** - Maintain consistency with existing code

### üîß Technical Tips

1. **Use the development environment** - Set up local development properly
2. **Write tests** - Add tests for new functionality
3. **Check dependencies** - Ensure all dependencies are properly managed
4. **Review existing code** - Learn from existing implementations
5. **Document changes** - Explain complex changes clearly

### üìö Documentation Tips

1. **Write clear descriptions** - Make your contributions easy to understand
2. **Include examples** - Show how to use new features
3. **Update related docs** - Keep all documentation in sync
4. **Use consistent formatting** - Follow the project's documentation style
5. **Be comprehensive** - Cover all aspects of your changes

---

**Ready to contribute?** Start by forking the repository and creating your first branch! üöÄ
content.pt:
# Contribuindo para [PROJECT_NAME]

Primeiro, obrigado por considerar contribuir para o [PROJECT_NAME]! S√£o pessoas como voc√™ que fazem do mundo open source um lugar incr√≠vel para aprender, inspirar e criar.

## ü§ù C√≥digo de Conduta

Este projeto e todos os participantes est√£o sob o [C√≥digo de Conduta](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). Ao participar, espera-se que voc√™ mantenha este c√≥digo. Por favor, reporte comportamentos inaceit√°veis para [CONTACT_EMAIL].

## üöÄ Como Posso Contribuir?

### Reportando Bugs

Esta se√ß√£o guia voc√™ atrav√©s do envio de um relat√≥rio de bug para o [PROJECT_NAME]. Seguir estas diretrizes ajuda os mantenedores e a comunidade a entender seu relat√≥rio, reproduzir o comportamento e encontrar relat√≥rios relacionados.

- **Use uma pesquisa clara e descritiva** para ver se o problema j√° foi reportado.
- **Verifique se o problema j√° foi corrigido** tentando reproduzi-lo na vers√£o mais recente.
- **Abra uma Issue** usando o template de Bug Report fornecido.

### Sugerindo Melhorias

Esta se√ß√£o guia voc√™ atrav√©s do envio de uma sugest√£o de melhoria para o [PROJECT_NAME], incluindo recursos completamente novos e pequenas melhorias na funcionalidade existente.

- **Use uma pesquisa clara e descritiva** para ver se a melhoria j√° foi sugerida.
- **Abra uma Issue** usando o template de Feature Request fornecido.

### Seu Primeiro Pull Request

1. Fa√ßa um Fork do reposit√≥rio.
2. Clone o projeto para sua m√°quina.
3. Crie uma branch para sua feature (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`).
4. Fa√ßa o commit de suas altera√ß√µes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`).
5. Fa√ßa o push para a branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`).
6. Abra um Pull Request.

## üé® Guia de Estilo

- [STYLE_GUIDE_LINK] - Se houver um guia de estilo espec√≠fico, linke-o aqui.
- Commits devem seguir a conven√ß√£o [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/).

## üõ†Ô∏è Configura√ß√£o de Desenvolvimento

[INSTRUCTIONS_TO_SETUP_DEV_ENVIRONMENT]

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

### Added

### Changed

### Deprecated

### Removed
- Nothing yet

### Fixed
- Nothing yet

### Security
- Nothing yet

## [1.0.0] - [RELEASE_DATE]

### Added
- üéâ Initial release of [PROJECT_NAME]
- [FEATURE_1] - [FEATURE_1_DESCRIPTION]
- [FEATURE_2] - [FEATURE_2_DESCRIPTION]
- [FEATURE_3] - [FEATURE_3_DESCRIPTION]

### Documentation

- Usage examples and best practices
- API documentation (if applicable)

---

## üìã Version Format

We use [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/) for version numbers:

- **MAJOR** version when you make incompatible API changes
- **MINOR** version when you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner
- **PATCH** version when you make backwards compatible bug fixes

## üîó Links

- [GitHub Repository]([GITHUB_REPO_URL])
- [Latest Release]([GITHUB_REPO_URL]/releases/latest)
- [Issue Tracker]([GITHUB_REPO_URL]/issues)

---

**Legend:**
- üéâ Major release
- ‚ú® New features
- üêõ Bug fixes

- üîß Configuration
- üé® Styling
- üåê Internationalization
- üí• Breaking changes
- üîí Security updates

content.en:
# Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include:

* Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
* Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
* Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
* Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes, and learning from the experience
* Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of any kind
* Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email address, without their explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

## Enforcement Responsibilities

Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces. Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at **[CONTACT_EMAIL]**.
All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter of any incident.

## Enforcement Guidelines

Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:

### 1. Correction
**Community Impact**: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.
**Consequence**: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.

### 2. Warning
**Community Impact**: A violation through a single incident or series of actions.
**Consequence**: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or permanent ban.

### 3. Temporary Ban
**Community Impact**: A serious violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior.
**Consequence**: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period. Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.

### 4. Permanent Ban
**Community Impact**: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment of an individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.
**Consequence**: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the community.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage], version 2.1, available at [https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html][v2.1].

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org
[v2.1]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html
content.pt:
# C√≥digo de Conduta

## Nosso Compromisso

N√≥s, como membros, contribuidores e l√≠deres, comprometemo-nos a fazer da participa√ß√£o em nossa comunidade uma experi√™ncia livre de ass√©dio para todos, independentemente da idade, tamanho corporal, defici√™ncia vis√≠vel ou invis√≠vel, etnia, caracter√≠sticas sexuais, identidade e express√£o de g√™nero, n√≠vel de experi√™ncia, educa√ß√£o, status socioecon√¥mico, nacionalidade, apar√™ncia pessoal, ra√ßa, casta, religi√£o ou identidade e orienta√ß√£o sexual.

Comprometemo-nos a agir e interagir de maneiras que contribuam para uma comunidade aberta, acolhedora, diversa, inclusiva e saud√°vel.

## Nossos Padr√µes

Exemplos de comportamento que contribuem para um ambiente positivo para nossa comunidade incluem:

* Demonstrar empatia e gentileza com outras pessoas
* Ser respeitoso com opini√µes, pontos de vista e experi√™ncias diferentes
* Dar e aceitar graciosamente feedback construtivo
* Aceitar responsabilidade e pedir desculpas aos afetados por nossos erros, e aprender com a experi√™ncia
* Focar no que √© melhor n√£o apenas para n√≥s como indiv√≠duos, mas para a comunidade em geral

Exemplos de comportamento inaceit√°vel incluem:

* O uso de linguagem ou imagens sexualizadas, e aten√ß√£o ou avan√ßos sexuais de qualquer tipo
* Trolling, insultos ou coment√°rios depreciativos, e ataques pessoais ou pol√≠ticos
* Ass√©dio p√∫blico ou privado
* Publicar informa√ß√µes privadas de outros, como um endere√ßo f√≠sico ou de e-mail, sem sua permiss√£o expl√≠cita
* Outra conduta que poderia razoavelmente ser considerada inadequada em um ambiente profissional

## Responsabilidades de Aplica√ß√£o

Os l√≠deres da comunidade s√£o respons√°veis por esclarecer e fazer cumprir nossos padr√µes de comportamento aceit√°vel e tomar√£o medidas corretivas apropriadas e justas em resposta a qualquer comportamento que considerem inadequado, amea√ßador, ofensivo ou prejudicial.

Os l√≠deres da comunidade t√™m o direito e a responsabilidade de remover, editar ou rejeitar coment√°rios, commits, c√≥digo, edi√ß√µes de wiki, issues e outras contribui√ß√µes que n√£o estejam alinhadas a este C√≥digo de Conduta, e comunicar√£o as raz√µes para as decis√µes de modera√ß√£o quando apropriado.

## Escopo

Este C√≥digo de Conduta aplica-se a todos os espa√ßos da comunidade e tamb√©m se aplica quando um indiv√≠duo est√° representando oficialmente a comunidade em espa√ßos p√∫blicos. Exemplos de representa√ß√£o de nossa comunidade incluem o uso de um endere√ßo de e-mail oficial, postagem por meio de uma conta oficial de m√≠dia social ou atua√ß√£o como representante nomeado em um evento online ou offline.

## Aplica√ß√£o

Inst√¢ncias de comportamento abusivo, assediador ou de outra forma inaceit√°vel podem ser relatadas aos l√≠deres da comunidade respons√°veis pela aplica√ß√£o em **[CONTACT_EMAIL]**.
Todas as reclama√ß√µes ser√£o revisadas e investigadas prontamente e de forma justa.

Todos os l√≠deres da comunidade s√£o obrigados a respeitar a privacidade e a seguran√ßa do rep√≥rter de qualquer incidente.

## Atribui√ß√£o

Este C√≥digo de Conduta √© adaptado do [Contributor Covenant][homepage], vers√£o 2.1, dispon√≠vel em [https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html][v2.1].

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org
[v2.1]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html

content.en:
# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

Use this section to tell people about which versions of your project are currently being supported with security updates.

| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 2.0.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| 1.0.x   | :x:                |
| < 1.0   | :x:                |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

We take the security of **[PROJECT_NAME]** seriously. If you have found a security vulnerability, please help us fix it.

### How to Report

1. **Do not open a public issue.** Publicly reporting a vulnerability can put the community at risk.
2. Please email us at **[CONTACT_EMAIL]** with the subject line "Security Vulnerability in [PROJECT_NAME]".
3. Include as much detail as possible:
   - Type of vulnerability (e.g., XSS, SQL Injection, RCE)
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Affected versions
   - Potential impact
4. We will acknowledge your email within **48 hours**.
5. We will keep you updated on the progress of the fix.

### Disclosure Policy

- We ask that you give us a reasonable amount of time to fix the issue before disclosing it to the public.
- We will credit you in the release notes and/or our "Security Hall of Fame" (if applicable) once the issue is resolved.

Thank you for helping keep **[PROJECT_NAME]** safe!
content.pt:
# Pol√≠tica de Seguran√ßa

## Vers√µes Suportadas

Use esta se√ß√£o para informar as pessoas sobre quais vers√µes do seu projeto est√£o sendo suportadas atualmente com atualiza√ß√µes de seguran√ßa.

| Vers√£o | Suportado          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 2.0.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| 1.0.x   | :x:                |
| < 1.0   | :x:                |

## Reportando uma Vulnerabilidade

Levamos a seguran√ßa do **[PROJECT_NAME]** a s√©rio. Se voc√™ encontrou uma vulnerabilidade de seguran√ßa, por favor, ajude-nos a corrigi-la.

### Como Reportar

1. **N√£o abra uma issue p√∫blica.** Reportar publicamente uma vulnerabilidade pode colocar a comunidade em risco.
2. Por favor, envie um e-mail para **[CONTACT_EMAIL]** com o assunto "Vulnerabilidade de Seguran√ßa em [PROJECT_NAME]".
3. Inclua o m√°ximo de detalhes poss√≠vel:
   - Tipo de vulnerabilidade (ex: XSS, SQL Injection, RCE)
   - Passos para reproduzir
   - Vers√µes afetadas
   - Impacto potencial
4. Confirmaremos o recebimento do seu e-mail dentro de **48 horas**.
5. Manteremos voc√™ atualizado sobre o progresso da corre√ß√£o.

### Pol√≠tica de Divulga√ß√£o

- Pedimos que nos d√™ um tempo razo√°vel para corrigir o problema antes de divulg√°-lo ao p√∫blico.
- Daremos cr√©dito a voc√™ nas notas de lan√ßamento e/ou em nosso "Hall da Fama de Seguran√ßa" (se aplic√°vel) assim que o problema for resolvido.

Obrigado por ajudar a manter o **[PROJECT_NAME]** seguro!

content.en:
# Support

Having trouble with **[PROJECT_NAME]**? We‚Äôre here to help!

## üìö Documentation

Before asking a question, please check our documentation:
- [README.md](./README.md)
- [Wiki]([WIKI_URL])
- [FAQ]([FAQ_URL])

## üêõ Reporting Bugs

If you found a bug, please open an issue in our [Issue Tracker]([GITHUB_REPO_URL]/issues).
Make sure to follow the **Bug Report** template to provide all necessary details.

## üí° Feature Requests

Have an idea for a new feature? We'd love to hear it!
Please submit a request via our [Issue Tracker]([GITHUB_REPO_URL]/issues) using the **Feature Request** template.

## üí¨ Community & Questions

If you have questions or just want to chat with other users:

- **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions]([GITHUB_REPO_URL]/discussions)
- **Discord**: [Join our Server]([DISCORD_LINK])
- **Twitter**: [Follow us]([TWITTER_LINK])
- **Email**: [CONTACT_EMAIL]

## üíº Commercial Support

For commercial support, consulting, or custom development, please contact us at: **[BUSINESS_EMAIL]**.

content.en:
# Roadmap

This document outlines the development plan for **[PROJECT_NAME]**.
*Note: This roadmap is subject to change based on community feedback and priorities.*

## üèÜ Goals

- [GOAL_1_DESCRIPTION]
- [GOAL_2_DESCRIPTION]
- [GOAL_3_DESCRIPTION]

## üìÖ Milestones

### Q1 [YEAR] - [MILESTONE_NAME_1]
- [ ] **Feature A**: Description of feature A
- [ ] **Feature B**: Description of feature B
- [ ] **Improvement**: Performance optimization for X

### Q2 [YEAR] - [MILESTONE_NAME_2]
- [ ] **Integration**: Support for [THIRD_PARTY_TOOL]
- [ ] **Refactor**: Clean up legacy code in module Y
- [ ] **Docs**: Complete API documentation

### Q3 [YEAR] - [MILESTONE_NAME_3]
- [ ] **Mobile App**: Beta release for iOS/Android
- [ ] **Localization**: Support for Spanish and French

## üîÆ Future Ideas (Backlog)

- [ ] AI Integration
- [ ] Dark Mode 2.0
- [ ] Plugin System

## ü§ù How to Contribute

We welcome contributions to help us achieve these goals! Check out our [CONTRIBUTING.md](./CONTRIBUTING.md) guide to get started.

templates.name: Governance Model
templates.description: How the project is governed and decisions are made.

content.en:
# Governance Model

## Overview
This project is managed by **[PROJECT_OWNER]** and the community. We aim to create a welcoming and inclusive environment for everyone.

## Roles and Responsibilities

### Project Lead / Benevolent Dictator
- **[PROJECT_OWNER]**: Responsible for the overall direction, release management, and final decision making.

### Maintainers
Maintainers are responsible for:
- Reviewing Pull Requests
- Triaging Issues
- Moderating the community
- Improving documentation

### Contributors
Anyone who submits a Pull Request or opens an issue is a contributor. We value all contributions!

## Decision Making Process
Decisions are made by consensus among the Maintainers. If consensus cannot be reached, the Project Lead has the final say.

## Becoming a Maintainer
Contributors who show dedication and quality work may be invited to become Maintainers.
content.pt:
# Modelo de Governan√ßa

## Vis√£o Geral
Este projeto √© gerenciado por **[PROJECT_OWNER]** e pela comunidade. Nosso objetivo √© criar um ambiente acolhedor e inclusivo para todos.

## Pap√©is e Responsabilidades

### L√≠der do Projeto / Ditador Benevolente
- **[PROJECT_OWNER]**: Respons√°vel pela dire√ß√£o geral, gerenciamento de lan√ßamentos e tomada de decis√£o final.

### Mantenedores
Mantenedores s√£o respons√°veis por:
- Revisar Pull Requests
- Triagem de Issues
- Modera√ß√£o da comunidade
- Melhorar a documenta√ß√£o

### Contribuidores
Qualquer pessoa que envie um Pull Request ou abra uma issue √© um contribuidor. Valorizamos todas as contribui√ß√µes!

## Processo de Tomada de Decis√£o
As decis√µes s√£o tomadas por consenso entre os Mantenedores. Se o consenso n√£o puder ser alcan√ßado, o L√≠der do Projeto tem a palavra final.

## Tornando-se um Mantenedor
Contribuidores que mostram dedica√ß√£o e trabalho de qualidade podem ser convidados a se tornarem Mantenedores.

templates.name: CODEOWNERS
templates.description: Define who owns what code in the repo.

content.en:
# This is a CODEOWNERS file.
# It allows you to define who is responsible for code in this repository.
# GitHub will automatically request reviews from these owners when a PR touches their code.

# Syntax:
# [file_pattern] [owner]

# Global owner (matches everything)
# *       @global-owner

# JavaScript files
# *.js    @js-owner

# Documentation
# /docs/  @docs-team

# Specific file
# LICENSE @legal-team
content.pt:
# Este √© um arquivo CODEOWNERS.
# Ele permite definir quem √© respons√°vel pelo c√≥digo neste reposit√≥rio.
# O GitHub solicitar√° automaticamente revis√µes desses propriet√°rios quando um PR alterar o c√≥digo deles.

# Sintaxe:
# [padrao_de_arquivo] [proprietario]

# Propriet√°rio global (corresponde a tudo)
# *       @dono-global

# Arquivos JavaScript
# *.js    @dono-js

# Documenta√ß√£o
# /docs/  @time-docs

# Arquivo espec√≠fico
# LICENSE @time-legal

content.en:
# üì• Pull Request

## üìù Description
Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed. Please also include relevant motivation and context. List any dependencies that are required for this change.

Fixes # (issue)

## üîÑ Type of Change
- [ ] üêõ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] ‚ú® New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] üí• Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] üìö Documentation update

## üß™ How Has This Been Tested?
Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce.

- [ ] Test A
- [ ] Test B

## ‚úÖ Checklist
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
content.pt:
# üì• Pull Request

## üìù Descri√ß√£o
Por favor, inclua um resumo da mudan√ßa e qual issue foi corrigida. Por favor, inclua tamb√©m motiva√ß√£o e contexto relevantes. Liste quaisquer depend√™ncias que s√£o necess√°rias para esta mudan√ßa.

Corrige # (issue)

## üîÑ Tipo de Mudan√ßa
- [ ] üêõ Corre√ß√£o de bug (mudan√ßa n√£o-quebrante que corrige uma issue)
- [ ] ‚ú® Nova funcionalidade (mudan√ßa n√£o-quebrante que adiciona funcionalidade)
- [ ] üí• Mudan√ßa quebrante (corre√ß√£o ou funcionalidade que faria a funcionalidade existente n√£o funcionar como esperado)
- [ ] üìö Atualiza√ß√£o de documenta√ß√£o

## üß™ Como Isso Foi Testado?
Por favor, descreva os testes que voc√™ executou para verificar suas mudan√ßas. Forne√ßa instru√ß√µes para que possamos reproduzir.

- [ ] Teste A
- [ ] Teste B

## ‚úÖ Checklist
- [ ] Meu c√≥digo segue as diretrizes de estilo deste projeto
- [ ] Eu realizei uma auto-revis√£o do meu pr√≥prio c√≥digo
- [ ] Eu comentei meu c√≥digo, particularmente em √°reas dif√≠ceis de entender
- [ ] Eu fiz as mudan√ßas correspondentes na documenta√ß√£o
- [ ] Minhas mudan√ßas n√£o geram novos avisos
- [ ] Eu adicionei testes que provam que minha corre√ß√£o √© eficaz ou que minha funcionalidade funciona
- [ ] Testes unit√°rios novos e existentes passam localmente com minhas mudan√ßas
